page.title: 01Horse-Eye Level Generally
page.content: Horse-Eye Level partly comes under the Rape of Pevensey, separates the town of Hailsham from Pevensey Marshes proper and skirts the village of Herstmonceux. It is predominantly farmland with enclosed rough grazing but where advance has taken place on the marsh some crops are now grown. A feature of the area is fields separated by dykes. In 1977 it was scheduled a site of special Scientific Interest for Flora and fauna, and notified under Section 23 of the National Parks and Access to Countryside Act 1949. Public Transport is sparse and apart from a small part of a Council Estate and a residential Caravan Park, housing is cottages and farm houses. Being so close to Hailsham and Eastbourne the area is used for recreational activities by people from outside the area.
